utils module¶

These utilitiy functions transform the indicies of neurons to their coordinates back and forth. A useful little script to have.

utils.aggregate_mons(sim, mon_name, SI=False)[source]¶

Aggregates the indices and timings of the spiking events from disk.

Parameters:

mon_name (str) – The name of monitor of interest

Returns:

tuple of indices and times (in ms)

Return type:

(array of ints, array of floats)

utils.balance_dist(t0, t_min=0, t_max=1)[source]¶
utils.coord2idx(coords, pop)[source]¶

Transforms the coordinates to the indices for a given population.

Parameters:

  • coords (numpy array of size (n,2)) – coordinates of n neuron

  • pop (Brian's NetworkGroup object) – population object

Returns:

array of indicies of length N of type int

Return type:

numpy array

utils.estimate_order_parameter(phis, k=None)[source]¶
utils.get_anisotropic_U(sim, syn_name, Umax)[source]¶
utils.get_line_idx(x0, y0, c, pop, eps=2)[source]¶
utils.get_post_idxs(syn, pre_idx)[source]¶
utils.get_post_locs(syn, pre_idx)[source]¶
utils.get_post_rel_locs(syn, pre_idx)[source]¶
utils.idx2coords(idxs, net)[source]¶

Transforms the a list of indices of the given population to coordinates.

Parameters:

  • idxs (list or numpy array) – list or array of coordinates. i.e., [(x1,y1), (x2,y2), …]

  • net (Brian's NetworkGroup object) – population object

Returns:

array of coordinates of size (N,2) of type int

Return type:

numpy array
